nodes.text: Zugga Entertainment was a company that attempted to open a podracing course in the Grand Aratech Gravidome on the planet Coruscant in 7944 C.R.C. This led Coruscant Security Force Lieutenant Tanivos Divo to compile a large case file on podracing. Zugga ultimately did not open the podracing course, and Tanivos' grandson Exantor Divo—who published portions of his grandfather's case files—commented that he thought this was most likely because the company learned of the police attention it was receiving.

Zugga Entertainment was first mentioned in the 2018 reference book Star Wars: Scum and Villainy: Case Files on the Galaxy's Most Notorious, which was written by Pablo Hidalgo. The company was named for the Zugga Challenge from the 1999 video game Star Wars Episode I: Racer.
